title: Econometrics for Public Policy Analysis
description: This module is for students who have some background in statistics and want to acquire additional techniques and experience. Topics include: latent class analysis, multinomial and nested logit models, power analysis, regression discontinuity, etc. Most classes will consist of one hour of lecture followed by two hours of workshop, where small groups of students provided with datasets will independently test out the models and produce their own novel findings. At the end of the module, students will produce a research paper in response to a real-world policy paper or report, and identify potential clients who would value their findings
prerequisite: PP5406 Quantitative Research Methods for Public Policy I or background in multiple regression analysis
